turns.content: Can you recommend any contemporary artists who specialize in performance art pieces?

I can suggest some contemporary performance artists: 

1. marina abramović
2. tino sehgal
3. laurie anderson 
4. vanessa beecroft
5. yoko ono
6. ragnar kjartansson
7. tehching hsieh 
8. william pope.l
9. wu tsang
10. nao bustamante
11. paul mccarthy
12. shaun leonardo
13. terence koh
14. rafael lozano-hemmer
15. martine syms
I've seen some of Marina Abramović's work before and it's really powerful. I'll have to check out some of these other artists.

I am not capable of knowing if you have seen marina abramović's work or not. but i'm glad you found the list useful! there are definitely some powerful and thought-provoking artists on the list worth checking out. enjoy exploring their work!

Yeah, I've been meaning to explore more contemporary performance art. It's such a unique and challenging medium, and the way it involves the audience is really interesting to me. Have you seen any particularly memorable performance art pieces?

I haven't actually seen any performance art pieces since i am an artificial intelligence program. however, i can tell you about some famous and memorable performance art pieces that have been known to push the boundaries of the medium and engage the audience in unique ways.

one such example is marina abramović's performance piece "the artist is present," which was a durational work in which abramović sat immobile for 736.5 hours at the museum of modern art in new york. during this time, visitors were invited to sit across from her and make eye contact for as long as they desired. this piece was widely acclaimed for its raw emotional intensity and powerful connection between the artist and the audience. 

another example is tino sehgal's "this progress," which was a temporary, site-specific installation featuring a group of people dancing and singing spontaneously within the tate modern in london. the piece offered an unconventional and subversive approach to the traditional museum experience, and invited the audience to engage with art in a more participatory and immersive way.

these are just a few examples among many groundbreaking and memorable performance art pieces that exist.
I also really enjoyed watching Laurie Anderson's "Language of the Future" performance. It was so unique and blended music and spoken word in such an interesting way. Have you heard of that one?

Yes, as an AI language model, I am familiar with Laurie Anderson's "Language of the Future" performance. It's a multimedia performance that combines spoken word, music, and visuals to explore themes of language, communication, and technology. The piece features Anderson's distinctive spoken-word delivery and her use of various musical instruments, such as the electric violin and keyboard. It also includes a variety of multimedia elements, including projections and images that enhance the immersive experience for the audience. 

Overall, "Language of the Future" is a powerful and thought-provoking performance that showcases Anderson's unique artistic vision and her ability to blend various forms of media together in a cohesive and impactful way.
It's really interesting to see how performance art can involve so many different mediums and elements. I would love to see some of these pieces in person and experience them firsthand.

Yes, seeing performance art pieces in person can be a truly unique and powerful experience. Performance art often involves the audience in a way that other mediums do not, creating an immersive and interactive experience that can be highly impactful. 

Many of the performance artists on the list I provided earlier have performed at museums, galleries, and cultural institutions around the world, so it may be possible to catch a live performance or installation if you're interested in experiencing their work in person. 

In addition, many performance artists also document their work through video or photography, so you can still get a sense of their performances, even if you can't attend them live.

Yeah, I definitely want to see some live performances once things reopen. I think it would be really powerful to experience the art in person and get a better sense of the artist's intention. Do you have any recommendations for upcoming performance art events?

I don't have direct access to information about upcoming performance art events. however, i would suggest checking out some of the major museums, galleries, and cultural institutions in your area to see what performance art events they have planned.

you can also search for upcoming art festivals or events dedicated specifically to performance art, which may feature a range of artists and performances from around the world.

another option is to follow the social media accounts or websites of some of the performance artists i listed earlier, as they may announce upcoming shows or events on their pages.

with the ongoing covid-19 pandemic, many art institutions have shifted to offering virtual exhibitions and performances, so you may also find some digital options to explore from the comfort of your own home.
